a.content:
Let's say \lim x_n = x, then

\begin {aligned} & x = \frac 1 {4-x} \\ & \rightarrow 4x - x^2 - 1=0 \end {aligned}

Solve quadratic equation, you get 2 \pm \sqrt3. But it has to be less than 3 so the answer is 2-\sqrt3 \approx 0.2679491924311227

q.content: Take the limit of each side of the recursive equation in part (a) to explicitly compute \lim x_n.
